captions.text: - Can I touch your hair?

Why sure you could touch my
hair, and you can pet me,
and you can water me...
NO!

I am not an animal, no
you can't touch my hair.
Is your hair real?
Yes, my hair is real.

And so is this, this
is my hair, it's real.
And this, this is my hair, it's real.
R-E-A-L it's real!
I wear real hair, I'm not cheap.
How much money does a weave cost?
How much money do you have?
The most expensive weaves you can buy
run in around $7000-$8000 and up.

Do you wanna look like
Boom Quita or Beyoncé?
Is Beyoncè's hair real?
No no no no nono nono.
Well who cares, it's gorgeous!
How often do I wash my hair?
I don't have to, I just throw it away.
Do you have hair?

People want to know if I'm
bald just because I wear wigs.
Am I bald?
Do I look bald?!
I am not bald!
There is plenty of hair right here.
I just don't want to comb it right now.
How long does it take you to do your hair?
(laughs)
One second.
What is a kitchen?

This is what we call the
kitchen, the back of your head.
What you call the nap of your hair.
That's where the word napping comes from.
Now you're educated.
Is it offensive to black people
when white people have dreadlocks?
What, did somebody really ask me that?
No, why do we care about your hair?
We've got problems of our own.
Who asked that question?
Who, was it you?
I know it was you.
That's a tumble-weave.
(laughing) Get it?
Tumble weave, that was funny y'all.

comments.author: Des

comments.text:
as to why black women weave: 

there are a myriad of reasons, some women want to try long straight hair 
without perming and damaging chemicals, and others have extremely tightly 
wound curls. i measured my curls in my hair... 5 mm. that's HALF A 
CENTIMETER. combing it out means hours of work and detangler. we dont have 
the time. braid it loosely and comfortably then put a pretty wig on and 
walk out the door it so much easier. i recently braided my hair into long 
singles. it works so well! some women are lucky to have looser curls, but 
those knot just as easy. it's all about having time to maintain it and 
keeping it from knotting beyond repair. ﻿
comments.author: Natalya Watson

comments.text:
+Northern Light actually, some people's hair is just so curly it looks 
short! my cousins have the same length of hair, but one has looser curls 
and the other has tightly wound hair. the tightly wound hair is close to 
her head and doesnt pass her shoulders while the loose ones curl down to 
almost mid back. pull them to full length and theyre the same length! it's 
fascinating really.
comments.author: Natalya Watson

comments.text:
Hmm. Thanks for great comment. So for some black people their hair does not 
grow that much and that is one of the reasons people wear wigs. I 
personally think short hair or bald look good for many black women too.
